availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin F. Bransom (Johnson County, Texas, Farmer and First Lieutenant (U.S.A.) )

body.p: Johnson County, Texas, Farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Elmina Bransom c1850. Father of James W. Bransom, Mary A. Bransom, George W. Bransom, Elmina Bransom, F.M. Bransom, Wood Bransom, David A. Bransom, Mary E. Bransom. Farmer in Dallas County, Texas in 1850. Married to Sarah A. Bransom c1860. Farmer in Johnson County, Texas in 1860. Served in 13th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A.) as First Lieutenant from December 23, 1863 to January 10, 1865.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Texas, Dallas County, p. 188.Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Texas, Johnson County, p. 176. ).Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 354. KYR-0002-222-013
